article:
{{enzyme
| Name = Chymosin EC_number = 3.4.23.4 CAS_number = 9001-98-3 IUBMB_EC_number =
| 3/4/23/4 GO_code = 0030602 image = CHYMOSIN COMPLEX WITH THE INHIBITOR CP-
| 113972.jpg width = caption =Crystal structure of bovine chymosin complex with
| the inhibitor CP-113972. ; 
}} 'Chymosin' or 'rennin' is an enzyme found in rennet. It is produced by
newborn ruminant animals in the lining of the fourth stomach to curdle the milk
they ingest, allowing a longer residence in the bowels and better absorption. It
used widely in the production of cheese. Bovine chymosin is now produced
recombinantly in , [[Aspergillus niger|Aspergillus niger var awamori]], and as
alternative resource.
